radiographic_examinations.findings: Distended gallbladder with a 3 cm obstructive gallstone at the gallbladder neck and associated gallbladder wall thickening. The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits; no focal liver mass; no ascites; no intrahepatic biliary dilation; pancreas appears normal; normal spleen echogenicity; no hydronephrosis in limited kidney views.
Distended gallbladder with hyperenhancing wall, some pericholecystic fluid, and a 3 cm gallstone at the gallbladder neck.
